content:
---
title: "Frequently Asked Questions"
date: 2017-07-05T01:44:46-04:00
weight: 40
draft: false
---
How do i register my Fire Stick to my Amazon account?

Make sure you have setup wifi
Navigate to Settings
Navigate to My Account and press the select button on your remote
Press the select button on your remote to confirm
Enter in your Amazon account information

 Do I need an Amazon Account to use a wonslung Fire Stick?
I set up each wonslung Fire Stick with a placeholder amazon account.  You do not need to set up an Amazon account to use kodi, however if you wish to use Amazon Prime Video, Netflix or any other offical App, you must use an amazon account. (see Registering my Fire Stick to my Amazon Account)

Why am I being asked to rent or buy a video?
Amazon sells this device as a viewing device for Amazon Video. Much of Amazon Video requires an Amazon Prime Membership.  You are probably looking for Kodi. If you have an Amazon Prime account or a netflix account (see Registering my Fire Stick to my Amazon Account)

 What the hell is a wonslung
wonslung is my internet handle.  You better recognize.

Is there a way to get more hd sources?
There is a pay service called Real-Debrid that gives you access to far more high quality HD links.  It's pretty low cost when you purchase 3-6 months at a time.  (documentation yet to be complete)

 Is there a way to create a list of favorite shows/movies?
Yes.  See Trakt TV (documentation yet to be completed)

What is this message asking me if i want to update my build? (What is wonslung Wizard)
Generally speaking, when everything is working the way it's supposed to, you shouldn't NEED to update.  However, sometimes addons change, other times they stop working.  I periodically cut a new build to fix these issues and add new features (or remove broken addons).  Due to this, i built in a build wizard, (wonslung Wizard).  (documentation yet to be completed)

---
title: "Navigating Fire Os"
date: 2017-07-05T04:54:42-04:00
draft: false
weight: 30
---
Navigating Menus
 Use the navigation button on the remote to move through the menus.
 
{{ note tite ="Return Home" }}
 You can always return to the "Home" Menu by pushing the &x2302; (Home) button on the remote
{{ /note }}

Most users want to get into Kodi Immediately. This is done by navigating down to "My Apps and Games" from the "Home" menu and selecting the Kodi App.

Menu Options
{{ warning title="Attention" }}
 Unless you have Amazon Prime(tm) The "*Your Videos*, *Movies*, and *TV Shows*" will cost money.
 You want to use the Kodi App more than likely.
{{ /warning }}

 &128269;
 Home
 Your Videos
 Movies
 TV Shows
 Apps
 Settings

---
title: "Getting Started"
date: 2017-07-01T23:32:40-04:00
weight: 20
draft: false
---

What's in the box

Amazon documentation
USB power cable
Fire Tv Alexa remote
Amazon Fire Stick
HDMI adapter dongle
USB power adapter

 Connecting the Fire Stick

{{ note title="Hint" }}
 you can use a powered usb port instead of the wall adapter if your television has one
{{ /note }}

The Remote

Using the remote is pretty simple.  

 Use the navigation buttons to move through menus.
 Use the select button to select highlighted menu item.
 Use the back button to move back a menu.
 Use the home button to return to the home menu.
 Use the menu button to bring up contect menus.

{{ note title="Hint" }}
 Some buttons have multiple features.  See  Kodi Section for navigation details within kodi
{{ /note }}
 Connecting to wifi

Before you can use the Fire Stick, you need to connect it to your wifi network.  
Use the following screenshots to guide you through connecting the firestick to your wifi network.

---
title: "Kodi"
date: 2017-07-02T04:52:25-04:00
weight: 30
draft: false
image: kodi.png
---
What is Kodi?

Kodi is software designed to serve as a media center. With 3rd party addons, it can play almost any type of video file and stream media from all over the internet. (3rd party addons are not affliated or supported by the kodi development team)

{{ warning title="First Start" }}
When you first start Kodi please allow 60-90 seconds before attempting use.
{{ /warning }}
 How to navigate Kodi
{{ note title ="Note" }}
These instructions are specific to the wonslung FireStick Skin kodi build
{{ /note }}
When you open Kodi you will see the following menu:

The Fire Stick remote navigation button is used to navigate the main menu menu. Most menu items have a drop down menu that is activated by pushing down.

{{ note title ="Note" }}
The menu items will generally stay the same in the wonslung FireStick Skin build but I may occasionally add or remove sections. I try to focus on working apps as opposed to stuffing the build with useless content
{{ /note }}
Main Menu drop down menus
Most main menu sections have a drop down menu. (*to activate the dropdown menu push the down arrow*)

 Kodi Menu widgets
Many menu items have live widgets. For example, the TV Shows section has a widget that displays the current most popular TV Shows.
{{ note title ="Note" }}
These widgets generally take a couple minutes to load when you first start kodi
{{ /note }}
To make use of widget, simply use the remote to navigate up, and then left or right to select the item you want, as shown in the images below.

Overview of Main Menu items (as of v1.5)
Search Search for movies and tv shows
Addons Addons for Kodi
Movies Find and watch movies
TV Shows Find and watch tv shows
Live TV Live tv channels and feeds
Sports Sporting events and pay per view
Kids Cartoons and children programs
Comedy Comedy movies and standup
Extra All in one apps
10. Music Music
11. Fitness Workout Videos
12. Programs Kodi programs and Android apps
13. Weather Local Weather
14. System Sytem Configuration (Please stay out of here if you don't know what you are doing)
15. Power Exit Kodi
